general_advisory: Based on five days weather forecast, farmers can continue intercultural operations, harvesting of matured products, and apply pesticides mixed with a sticker as needed. Field preparation should be started for rabi crops. Regular surveillance work should be done in all crops to know the incidence of various insect pests and initiate control strategies.

advisory: For neck blast disease management apply Tricyclazole (Beam) @ 0.6 g/l of water (120 g/ac).
To control steam borer & leaf folder spray chlorpyriofos/profenofos @ 2 ml/ l of water.
Spray Imidachloprid @ 0.6 ml / liter of water to control the BPH.
To control ear cutting caterpillar, spray Quinalphos 25 EC @ 400ml/acre or Chlorpyriphos 20 EC @ 500ml/ acre at root zone in morning hours.
For American Cob Borer infestation, apply Flubendiamide 39.35 % SC @ 4 ml mixed with 10 liters of water.
Present weather conditions are favorable for sowing of Horse gram & Bengal gram.
Take advantage of available soil moisture and start land preparation and sowing of the crop for optimum yield.
Suitable varieties: Toria - Anuradha, Parbati, Sushree, Indian mustard - Pusa Bold, Pusa Jai kisan. Seed rate - 8-10 Kg/ha, Spacing - 30 cm X 10 cm.
Spray neem oil 5 ml/ l of water to control insects in mustard & toria at seedling stage.
Go for weeding and apply 26 kg urea and 30 kg MoP per acre at 90 days after planting and apply mulching @ 2 t/acre.
Prepare nursery beds with well decomposed FYM and chlorpyriphos dust.
Transplant mature seedlings of cauliflower in raised bed during clear weather.
List of suitable varieties for cauliflower.
Regularly monitor cauliflower crops for insect pests.
Prepare nursery beds with well decomposed FYM and chlorpyriphos dust.
List of suitable varieties for cabbage.
Complete 3rd weeding and 3rd top dressing.
Soil drench with recommended products to control rhizome rot.
Remove infected plants from the field.
Regularly check animals for signs of dehydration, heat stress, and parasitic infections.
Deworm animals as needed and vaccinate them against common diseases.
